Message.Title: Ebay forecasting growth of 20+% starting this Q::: mobil shopping increasing 20+%/year
Message.Msg: ""First quarter 2013 online shopping grew more than 20 percent over 1Q 2012, ""
Paradym shift in consumer shopping habits to mobil shoppng: destop, smartphones, tablets. EBAY/PAYPAL, amzn, apple, google on the forefront and molders of this movement

Message.Title: Just maybe Ebay @ $100 by next year sometime
Message.Msg: Who knows maybe even $150. Ebay has all the internet/ecommerce/mobile buzz words. Global growth thru discover parthnership, & thru PayPal. Ebay's mobile shopping % could go from 17+% to over 30%

Message.Msg: let's see if you are not Short or Long Ebay and wouldn't touch Ebay Then Why are you here?

Message.Msg: Consumer Properties Statistic of Local Corp Monthly Uniqe Visitors: Over 30 million Monthly Page Views: Approximal 50 million Page Views per Visit: 2.5 views in the average Impressions: 1.2 billion

Topic.Title: Ebay should close Friday (today) above $56.00, I was looking for $57.00 on Friday, I missed this one.

Message.Msg: BECAUSE as a former eBay investor who has spent more than 10 years selling on eBay, I choose to warn others about the dangerous nature of eBay and that eBay is a house of cards waiting to be toppled over.

Topic.Title: Just maybe Ebay @ $100 by next year sometime

Message.Msg: eBay is more likely to drop back to the $20-$25 level where it belongs than ever hit $100. Wishful thinking. As I've said numerous times before, try selling something on eBay, call customer service and then tell me if you believe in this shoddy company?

Message.Title: US consumer favoring PayPal
Message.Msg: ""A recent study by comScore shows that the U.S market is greatly skewed toward PayPal."" The real growth for Ebay is PayPay (MOBILE and brick&mortal stores).
